sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が関白太政大臣のころ（天正13年（1585年））、当時の当主であった山科言経が勅勘を蒙って地方へ下ったため、庶流であった教利が山科家を代表して朝廷に仕えた。
sen.e: When Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI was in the position of Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister) (1585), Tokitsune YAMASHINA, who was the family head at that moment, was punished by Imperial order and was demoted to one province, and therefore, Noritoshi, who was from a branch family served the Imperial Court, taking over Tokitsune's position as the representative of the Yamashina family.

sen.j: しかし秀吉の死後、徳川家康の取り成しによって、慶長3年（1598年）言経が朝廷に復帰したため、教利はやむなく分家して猪熊家を興した。
sen.e: However, after the death of Hideyoshi, Tokitsune retuned to the Imperial Court in 1598 thanks to Ieyasu TOKUGAWA's mediation, and Noritoshi, who was obliged to split off from the Yamashina family, formed the Inokuma family.

sen.j: 教利は『源氏物語』の光源氏を想起させる「天下無双」の美男子で、その髪型や帯の結び方が「猪熊様（いのくまよう）」と称されて京都の流行になるほど評判であったが、かねてから女癖の悪さにも定評があり、「公家衆乱行随一」と称されていたとされる。
sen.e: Noritoshi was '天下無双'の美男子a handsome young man 'second to none' reminding everyone of Hikaru Genji in "Genji Monogatari" (The Tale of Genji), his hair style and 帯の結び方the type of knot he applied to obi (a sash for traditional Japanese garment) were called 'Inokuma style,' and his style was so highly-reputed that it became 京都の流行a fashion in Kyoto, however, he was also notorious for his 女癖の悪さmissing around with women and it is said that he was also called 'the most immoral man of court nobles.'

Noritoshi was 'more handsome than any other man under the sun,' reminding everyone of Hikaru Genji in "Genji Monogatari" (The Tale of Genji), and so highly-reputed for his beauty that his hair style and his way of knotting obi (a sash for traditional Japanese garment) were called 'Inokuma style' and became a major trend in Kyoto, but he was also notorious for messing around with women and it is said that he was also called 'the most immoral man of court nobles.'

sen.e: 慶長12年(1607年)2月Around February or March 1607, his adultery with a Imperial court lady was revealed, and as a result, he was punished and expelled for a while from Kyoto by the Imperial order of Emperor Goyozei, however, even after returning again to Kyoto, his loose moral was not rectified and he continued having illicit liaisons with court ladies, taking many high court nobles out with him.

sen.j: 慶長14年（1609年）7月、参議烏丸光広ら公家衆の密通が露顕する事件（猪熊事件）が起きると、乱交の手引きをしていた教利は京都所司代の追及を恐れて九州へ逃亡する。
sen.e: In August 1609, when adulteries of Kugeshu (court nobles) such as Sangi (Councilor) Mitsuhiro KARASUMARU were discovered (the Inokuma Incident), Noritoshi, who was helping their promiscuities, was afraid of the persecution of Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) and ran away to Kyushu region.
